oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sirenius M. Mort tintype_001
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Civil War tintype of Sirenius M. Mort, 1st Lt., Co. F, 9th Tennessee Cavalry Volunteers, U.S.A. Lt. Mort is pictured seated, holding a sword. There is some tinting on the tintype; the belt buckle, buttons and bars on the uniform are highlighted in gold and the sash is colored purple or dark red. Housed in a Daguerreotype Union Case made by Littlefield, Parsons & Co. The case is embossed with an eagle and the U.S. flag. A newspaper obituary for Lt. Mort was found folded in the case. He died on July 15, 1869. He was a member of a well known family of potters in Jefferson County, TN.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Portraits; Tintypes; Military officers; Military uniforms;
